DOC.brief_title: Integrating Buprenorphine Into SFGH AIDS Program
DOC.detailed_description: The UCSF Positive Health Program ( formerly call AIDS Program ) San Francisco General Hospital ( SFGH ) one old large HIV/AIDS clinic United States . Located public hospital serve medically indigent resident San Francisco , Positive Health Program ( PHP ) provide 2,000 patient visit per month 2,300 patient comprehensive HIV primary care set . The clinic population disproportionately affect heroin opiate abuse problem . Opiate replacement therapy ( ORT ) stabilize effect HIV-infected injecting drug user ( IDU ) associate great acceptance antiretroviral ( ARV ) therapy , high ARV adherence , great engagement appropriate HIV-related health care . However , insufficient resource meet critical substance abuse treatment need among opioid-dependent patient . In partnership Community Behavioral Health Services ( CBHS ) section San Francisco Department Public Health ( SFDPH ) , UCSF Positive Health Program ( PHP ) San Francisco General Hospital ( SFGH ) develop model care , provide opioid-dependent patient integrate , office-based buprenorphine ORT HIV primary care set . The program also offer primary care provider education train addiction , opiate addiction treatment , appropriate use buprenorphine . An evaluation program plan examine : ( 1 ) effect health substance use patient ; ( 2 ) program cost ; ( 3 ) broad impact program provider , institution , local system . In patient evaluation study , eligible , opioid-dependent patient receive primary HIV care PHP randomly assign receive buprenorphine ORT twelve month either integrated HIV primary care set ( intervention group ) versus non-integrated substance abuse treatment clinic setting ( comparison group ) . Data abstract medical chart review collect patient use standardized instrument satisfaction survey .
